# R Markdown

Here is some free text

```{r myChunk, message=FALSE}
# Insert a code chunk with the hotkey combination: Ctrl + Alt + i
# Specify a chunk name with characters, numbers, and hyphens after the "r" in {}
# echo = FALSE -> hide the code chunk in the knitted document, only revealing the code output
# eval = FALSE -> do not evaluate the code (no result will output)
# include = FALSE -> hide the code chunk and do not evaluate in the knitted document
# message = FALSE -> hide messages from code that outputs messages when run

library(tidyverse)
2 + 2
```

```{r}
max_height <- max(women$height)
```

The maximum women's height is `r max_height`
  The "r" indicates that the following code is in the R language

# Tables

```{r}
pacman::p_load(tidyverse, flextable, gt, reactable)
# flextable: widest range of formats
# gt: best for rich tables in HTML format
# reactable: for large, scrollable tables in HTML format


flextable::flextable(women)
gt::gt(women)
reactable::reactable(women)
```

# Plots

```{r fig.height=7, fig.width=3}
ggplot(women) + geom_point(aes(height, weight))
```

# Ebola Analysis

# Cases by district

This table shows counts of cases by district:

```{r echo = FALSE}
district_tab <- tabyl(ebola_sierra_leone, district)
flextable::flextable(district_tab)
```

# Visualize categorical variables

```{r}
categ_vars_plot<- show_plot(inspect_cat(ebola_sierra_leone))
categ_vars_plot
```

# Visualize numeric variables

```{r}
num_vars_plot <- show_plot(inspect_num(ebola_sierra_leone))
num_vars_plot
```

This is an *AMAZING* R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r cars}
summary(cars)
```

# Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
